_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: backup power to power the flare, instrument air, and gas-holder blowers
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: rupture discs, pumps, grinders, solid input device motor, agitators, feeding system, gas upgrading equipment, boilers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Shell New Energies (SNE) Junction City, OR is a Biomethane production facility. The digestion plant uses feedstock types of agricultural crop residues (Type 1) and manure (Type 2) to produce Biomethane which is injected into a commercial pipeline for use in producing renewable Compressed Natural Gas (CNG). The RMP regulated substance at the SNE Junction City facility is methane. 
The RMP-covered process at the facility is the Biomethane production process. This includes the digester feed system, digesters, digestate storage tanks, post digestion gas holders, gas upgrading system, and associated pumps, piping, and flare.
For the purposes of RMP reporting, methane is classified and modeled as a flammable gas. The quantity of methane in the system is documented in an inventory excel spreadsheet maintained by the facility, which includes the masses of methane in all vessels and interconnected piping. 

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Shell endeavors in all its activities to promote a quality environment. We recognize that activities at this facility may impact our employees and the surrounding community. Because of this, Shell is dedicated to environmental protection, employee health and safety, regulatory compliance and pollution prevention through a strategy of continual improvement and teamwork.

Our company environmental, health, and safety (EHS) policy and requirements promote the overall safety of this facility, our employees, and the public. This policy includes risk reduction programs that provide assurance for the safe management of process risks to prevent environmental, health and safety incidents and to protect the workplace, the community and the environment. Shell is committed to complying with the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard, Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1910.119, and EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) regulations, Title 40 CFR Part 68, to deal with the risks involved with the storage, handling,

and processing of methane. This program enables the facility to prevent the occurrence, or minimize the consequences of, significant releases of methane.

It is Shell's policy to conduct our business in accordance with all applicable laws, regulations, and permits and to promote a safe workplace and a quality environment. Each employee is trained and required to comply strictly with this policy.

Stationary Source and Regulated Substance
The Shell New Energies, Junction City, Oregon - Biogas Facility located at 92757 State Hwy 99, Junction City, Oregon conducts a biogas production process that generates methane (74-82-8). The facility is classified as a Prevention Program 3 and is regulated by EPA RMP and OSHA PSM for the flammable substance methane which is held on site in excess of 10,000 lbs.
 
General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention

Five-Year Accident History
The facility  has not had a release of a regulated substance that has caused any injuries to employees or impacted any offsite receptors in the past five years.

Emergency Response Program
An ERP has been developed to provide a formal emergency preparedness program that protects human health and property in the event of an emergency such as fire, medical, severe weather event, etc. This plan also formalizes the arrangements with local police, fire departments, hospitals, and emergency response personnel in case of an event. A copy of
this plan is reviewed with each employee.

Planned Changes
Shell continues to review its programs and procedures and make improvements where necessary. At this time, no significant improvement needs have been identified.
